intro: Giliastrum stewartii, commonly known as Stewart's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the petals. Giliastrum stewartii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
